intro: Tinus ternatensis, commonly known as the Ternate tinus, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
